meanings.definition: A person who transfers ownership of property to another.
meanings.sent1: The aliener signed the papers to give the house to his friend.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent acted as the aliener in the property transfer.
meanings.sent3: The aliener accidentally gave away his favorite book instead of the one he meant to.
meanings.sent4: She was like an aliener of memories, passing them on to her children.
meanings.sent5: The aliener's role was crucial in the legal process of property transfer.

meanings.definition: To transfer ownership of property to another.
meanings.sent1: He decided to aliener his car to his brother before moving abroad.
meanings.sent2: The businessman alienered the land to the local community for a park.
meanings.sent3: She alienered her old clothes to charity to make space in her closet.
meanings.sent4: The act of alienering the house brought a sense of relief to the family.
meanings.sent5: Alienering the business was a tough decision, but it was necessary for his retirement plans.
